decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence of low to mid-cost creatures such as Hunted Witness, Snubhorn Sentry, and Venerated Loxodon, supported by powerful spells like Heroic Reinforcements and Conclave Tribunal. Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants provides additional creature support and buffing capabilities. History of Benalia adds additional creature tokens and buffs. The mana base is heavily focused on white with a splash of red for support cards. The overall strategy is to swarm the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. Alongside removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt, the deck aims to control the board while steadily increasing its own board presence. The inclusion of cards like Vivien Reid and Carnage Tyrant provides additional reach and resilience against control decks, while the graveyard recursion from Memorial to Folly and Find / Finality maintains card advantage and board presence throughout the match.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger to gain value and pressure the opponent, alongside removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra to deal with threats, the deck aims to maintain board control and grind out victories. With a mix of early game aggression and late game powerhouses like Carnage Tyrant, the Golgari Aggro deck can adapt to different matchups and assert dominance on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix ability and take advantage of the Goblin Electromancer's cost reduction. By efficiently drawing cards and discarding spells, the deck aims to fill the graveyard with instant and sorcery cards to bring back the Phoenix and power up Crackling Drake. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast plays and deal damage quickly, utilizing burn spells like Shock and Lava Coil to control the board while maintaining aggressive pressure.

The main strategy of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with board wipes and spot removal, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Niv-Mizzet, Parun, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to ensure that it can answer any threats that come its way.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells, while utilizing cards like Thorn Lieutenant, Jadelight Ranger, and Vivien Reid to generate card advantage and maintain a strong battlefield. The deck also incorporates planeswalkers like Vraska, Relic Seeker and Vraska, Golgari Queen to provide additional threats and removal options. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive creatures like Plaguecrafter and Ravenous Chupacabra to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card draw, while also utilizing Treasure Map to ramp up mana. Niv-Mizzet and Teferi provide win conditions, with Niv-Mizzet dealing damage and drawing cards, and Teferi generating card advantage and controlling the board. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's game plan, stall the game out with removal and counters, and then finish with a powerful win condition. The deck is designed to out-value and outlast opponents through card advantage and control.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards that allow for card draw and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while clearing the opponent's creatures. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage spells and powerful fliers like Crackling Drake and Arclight Phoenix. The inclusion of Goblin Electromancer reduces the cost of spells, allowing for more efficient plays. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Merfolk Branchwalker, and Llanowar Elves while using removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down to control the opponent's board. The deck also utilizes powerful  finishers like Doom Whisperer, Carnage Tyrant, and Vivien Reid to push for a quick victory. The synergy between explore creatures and graveyard recursion from Memorial to Folly allows for a consistent flow of threats to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win through aggressive gameplay.

This deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through counter spells, board wipes, and removal while generating card advantage and value through card draw and powerful threats. The key strategy is to delay the opponent's threats, establish a stable board presence with powerful creatures like Niv-Mizzet and Teferi, and ultimately outvalue the opponent in the late game. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to all three colors, enabling the player to efficiently counter spells, remove threats, and draw cards throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures like Rekindling Phoenix and Siege-Gang Commander, backed up by burn spells like Lava Coil and Banefire to finish off the game quickly. Cards like Legion Warboss and Goblin Chainwhirler help maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. Additionally, Dire Fleet Daredevil provides versatility by allowing you to cast spells from your opponent's graveyard. The deck also includes utility lands like Arch of Orazca and Treasure Map to provide card advantage and ensure a consistent mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost spells that benefit from Goblin Electromancer's cost reduction and generating card advantage with spells like Radical Idea and Chart a Course. By filling the graveyard with spells, Arclight Phoenix can be brought back for repeated attacks. Enigma Drake and Crackling Drake provide flying threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and burn spells, making it difficult for them to keep up.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression with a mix of creatures and powerful removal spells to control the board. By utilizing powerful creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Carnage Tyrant, and JadeLight Ranger, along with removal such as Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down, this Golgari Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. The cards like Find / Finality and Vivien Reid provide card advantage and versatility, while also having some mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl. This deck aims to establish an early board presence and maintain pressure until victory.

The main idea of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with powerful creatures like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Rekindling Phoenix. The deck also includes some flexible cards like Expansion / Explosion for added versatility. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control of the board and out-valuing the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Jadelight Ranger, while using removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to control the opponent's threats. Cards like Find / Finality and Memorial to Folly provide recursion and card advantage, and powerful creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Doom Whisperer help to close out the game. Vivien Reid and Karn, Scion of Urza provide additional card advantage and versatile abilities to support the game plan. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo to secure victory.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and discard effects. It aims to control the board with cards like Ritual of Soot and Vraska's Contempt while also generating card advantage with Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. The deck also includes cards for card draw and card selection like Treasure Map and Expansion / Explosion. By controlling the game tempo and efficiently removing threats, this deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and win through powerful late-game threats.
